param.name: figure.title.placement
param.desc: Controls the placement of the figure title relative to the image.

param.name: css.processor.path.prince
param.desc: Path to the Prince executable file (eg: "C:\path\to\prince.exe" on Windows) which should be run to generate the PDF.

param.name: css.processor.path.antenna-house
param.desc: Path to the Antenna House executable file (eg: "C:\path\to\AHFCmd.exe" on Windows) which should be run to generate the PDF.

param.name: css.processor.path.chemistry
param.desc: Path to the oXygen PDF Chemistry executable file (eg: "C:\path\to\chemistry.bat" on Windows) which should be run to generate the PDF. If this parameter is not set, the plugin will use the system's PATH environment variable to find and start oXygen PDF Chemistry.

param.name: show.changes.and.comments
param.desc: When set on 'yes', the user comments, colored highlights and trackchanges are shown in the output.

param.name: dita.css.list
param.desc: You can use this to specify a list of CSS URLs to be used by the PDF processor. The files must have URL syntax and be separated using semicolons. If the value is empty, then the DITA topics/maps CSS files (currently selected from the oXygen [Styles] dropdown) are used.

param.name: args.css
param.desc: You can use this to specify a list of CSS URLs to be used in addition to the dita.css.list parameter. The files must have URL syntax and be separated using semicolons.

param.name: pdf.publishing.template
param.desc: Specifies the path to the folder containing the custom PDF template.

param.name: pdf.publishing.template.descriptor
param.desc: Specifies the name of the descriptor to be loaded from the PDF template package. If it is not specified, the first encountered descriptor will be automatically loaded.

param.name: args.css
param.desc: You can use this to specify a list of CSS URLs to be used in addition to the default CSS list from the publishing template. The files must have URL syntax and be separated using semicolons.
